WYSIWYM.transformer
Class QueryBuilder

java.lang.Object
  WYSIWYM.transformer.GraphTransformer
      WYSIWYM.transformer.SemanticGraphTransformer
          WYSIWYM.transformer.FeedbackTextGenerator
              WYSIWYM.transformer.QueryBuilder

public class QueryBuilder
extends FeedbackTextGenerator

QueryBuilder steers the process of building a query; a feedbacktextgenerator for the querying module.

Version:
1.0 17-07-2007, 1.2 31-01-2008, 1.5 21-08-2008
Author:
Feikje Hielkema

public QueryResultGenerator getResult()
                               throws SPARQLException,
                                      SesameException,
                                      IOException
Generates the SPARQL realisation of the graph, queries Sesame and returns a SemanticGraph transformer containing all matches of the query, plus the information about them that was asked for.

Returns:
QueryResultGenerator, which generates descriptions of the search results

multipleValuesUpdate

public int multipleValuesUpdate(String anchor,
                                String property,
                                String[] values,
                                int datatype,
                                int operator)
                         throws IOException
Adds multiple values for one property in one go. Only for datatype properties.

Parameters:
anchor - Unique ID of Anchor
property - Property name
values - a String containing the values that the user has specified for the property
datatype - Property's datatype (0 = string, 1 is Integer, 2 is Double)
operator - boolean operator (and, or, not)
Throws:
IOException

                                                int seqNr)

getCheckedOptionals

public Boolean[] getCheckedOptionals()
The graph stores at all times which statements the user has currently checked as 'optional'; when regenerating the feedback text this information is needed to update the interface and prevent the user from having to check all boxes again!

Returns:
Boolean[] which states which requirements are currently optional
